title: News regarding BlockChain Verify
story_body:
BlockChain Verify Appoints New VP of Business Development, Plans Industry Conference Participation

BlockChain Verify Inc. (BLK) announced today the appointment of Sarah Chen as Vice President of Business Development, effective November 1. Chen joins the company from DataTrust Solutions, where she served as Senior Director of Strategic Partnerships for the past four years.

"Sarah brings valuable experience in enterprise technology sales and partnership development," said Michael Torres, Chief Commercial Officer at BlockChain Verify. "Her background in digital identity solutions will support our growth objectives in the financial services sector."

Chen holds an MBA from Northwestern University's Kellogg School of Management and previously held positions at Accenture and IBM. She will report directly to Torres and oversee the company's partnership strategy across North America.

The company also announced its participation in the upcoming Digital Identity Summit 2024, scheduled for December 5-7 in San Francisco. BlockChain Verify executives will host a booth in the exhibition hall and participate in two panel discussions focused on distributed ledger applications in identity verification.

Additionally, BlockChain Verify revealed plans to launch a new marketing campaign titled "Trust in Every Transaction" beginning in January. The multi-channel initiative will include digital advertising, webinars, and thought leadership content aimed at raising awareness of the company's verification solutions among mid-market financial institutions.

As part of its environmental commitments, BlockChain Verify announced a partnership with CarbonNeutral.org to offset the carbon footprint of its data center operations. The initiative, which begins in Q1 2024, aims to achieve carbon neutrality for the company's primary data facilities by the end of 2025.

"We recognize the importance of sustainable business practices in the technology sector," said Jennifer Liu, BlockChain Verify's Head of Corporate Responsibility. "This carbon offset program represents a first step in our broader environmental strategy."

The company reported that these initiatives align with its steady business operations and do not materially impact financial guidance for the current fiscal year. BlockChain Verify maintains its focus on expanding its customer base in the financial services and healthcare sectors while continuing to develop its core verification platform.

BlockChain Verify provides blockchain-based identity verification and document authentication services to enterprises across multiple industries.
